MacroOp.Name: OMNI_SLEEP1
MacroOp.Brief: A helper macro for millisecond sleeps
MacroOp.Considerations: While the sleep specified is meant for 1ms sleep, it can be typical for a sleep to take approximately 10-15ms due to @_time slicing and kernel timing. So a 1ms sleep might be 1ms, 10ms or even 0 (i.e. no sleep).
MacroOp.PlatformSpecific: OMNI_SLEEP expands to the Windows Sleep API and the nanosleep function on others to achieve millisecond sleep resolution.
